peopleAlsoAsk.question: What is the app that value old books?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: AbeBooks is very useful for finding an approximate value of a book but don't use that value for insurance purposes. If you really need a documented estimate of a book's value (for probate or insurance purposes) then visit your local rare bookshop and pay for a formal appraisal.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Finding the value of old books - AbeBooks

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How do I find the value of old books near me?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: The Antiquarian Booksellers Association of America's site has a helpful feature called 'Find Member Bookseller' where you can cross-reference the subject of your book(s) and your location, for a dealer who specializes in the subject of your books and who is geographically close to you.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: How much is my book worth? - Ask a Librarian - The Library of Congress

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How do you get old books valued?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Use online platforms, book collector databases, and auction sites to see how much similar books are being sold for. This gives you a ballpark figure for your book's value.
